review: A perfect smile is what provides one with confidence...and only perfect teeth can provide one such smile. I am a college student. One day in college I slipped from the stairs and broke half of one of my incisors. It was very painful and also looked very bad. I was looking for a highly qualified, understanding and dependable doctor and Dr. Shuvro Sengupta met all my needs. After talking to the doctor for the very first time I felt  very good as he  explained me what are the remedies for my pain. I had the broken half of my tooth with me. As  I had to go to  college the next day  Dr. Shuvro Sengupta perfectly managed to join that broken half  of my tooth. It looked almost natural. I was very much pleased with that.  I think that was the fastest solution possible. Then he prescribed me a root canal treatment as soon as possible. It was going good until my tooth started to pain. The pain was random and immense.  Dr. Shuvro Sengupta  told me to undergo a root canal treatment as soon as possible but I got a bit late which caused to linger my tooth pain. I went to visit Dr Shuvro Sengupta again. I went through a painless RCT. He asked me numerous times whether I was feeling uncomfortable or any sort of pain while he was performing the RCT. After that it went just fine for nearly seven months without any pain or problem until the broken half of my tooth that was temporarily fixed got detached while  I was trying to eat a  roasted corn with that teeth. That was very careless of me. Then finally I went to  visit Dr. Shuvro Sengupta again and in just two sittings my broken tooth was perfectly crowned. The crowned tooth of mine looks  totally natural and feels very good and strong. The overall experience was very good.  I am very thankful to him for providing me with such a wonderful and caring treatment. So I have got back my smile and thus my confidence .

It is an honour to write a review for the dental treatment administered by Dr Sengupta. I was recovering from a very critical post-covid haul when I realized that I needed some dental treatment. As his clinic is situated in the same neighbourhood where I stay; I approached him one day with little doubt on how my new dentist was going to be. After my first visit, I was convinced that I came to the right dentist as he explained what were the problems and how they could be treated. I have done two re-RCT and changed my over-sized crown of one tooth, treated pockets which was troubling me for months and without any hassle. 
Dr Sengupta's clinic is clean and disabled friendly. He pays extra attention to covid protocols and keeps the space hygienic. He also uses very good quality material, and the best part is that for a curious and fussy patient like me, he explains every thing very patiently! He is very professional and as well as friendly. At one point I have thought, our country needs good doctors like him who has such sound knowledge of the profession they are in and providing services to so many citizens. 
During one of the sessions, which dragged for 2 months, I faced a neuro related pain. He took extra care by following up with me, recommended the right medicine and never charged me extra for follow-up consultations.
